title: How much music theory knowledge is required to compose music? - Quora

Any honest answer must ask for more details regarding what you wish to be able to do. For example, are you referring to simple songs or symphonic orchestral music? With a knack for tunes and a nice sense of rhythm, great songs can be written without a formal knowledge of music. Remember, Paul McCartney (in his Beatles days) wrote almost all of the actual music for the songs he co-wrote with John Lennon. Lennon wrote words, McCartney wrote tunes. McCartney also could not then (and to this day still cannot) read or write music. However, he did enjoy the services of trained musicians who helped him greatly. So, I would also recommend to EVERYONE wanting to compose music of any type to learn the basics of reading and writing of tunes and simple chords. BTW, YouTube is bursting at the seams with free-of-charge web sites to assist you with learning chords. Also, learn the structures of keys (major, minor, and some of the more delicious and exotic “modes” (Lydian is one of my favorites. It gives the unique flavor to Bernstein’s Maria, from West Side Story.) Again, there are many, many web sites to assist with this. Just search Google (or your search engine of choice!) for such key words as learning basic scales and harmony, writing melodies, etc. Once you get started, just continue to search for the key words that represent what you need at that moment. One last word — don’t hurry (especially at first). Now, with regard to serious music (Sonatas, String Quartets, stuff like that), the answer is quite different. It is critical to master each step, one at a time. In any structured environment (and these will, in the end, be your fastest route to take) you will bypass early mistakes that are so easily made by beginners. Also, please, please, please find a good instructor. He/she needn’t be a professor. A second- or third-year music major from a local college would be quite fine for your early studies. You would be in fine hands with such a person. I know that that I’ve been vague on details, but that is my intention. I hope, however, to have cleared the air regarding how to proceed, regarding your particular status at the moment (and only you can assess that for yourself right now). Write again if you have further questions regarding your progress. Best of luck! Music has been the most beautiful pursuit of my life. I hope it becomes such in yours.
